title.narrative: Investment preparatory study for an expansion and investment in laser welding production in India

description.narrative: Omega Thermo Products B.V. develops and applies state-of-the-art heat transfer technology to provide customers and end users with an optimum solution for their heat transfer applications.Headquartered in the Netherlands, Omega supplies components, systems, and solutions, based on proprietary technology named pillowplate, to a variety of industries including the water, beverage, food, chemical, paper & pulp, dairy, pharmaceutical and marine industries. Omega’s technology provides greater process efficiency, longer life cycles, and cost savings ensuring a more sustainable operation. Omega’s laser welded exchanger panels, pillowplates, plate coils, falling film chillers, ice banks, immersion chillers, heat recovery units and custom build heat exchangers are the world’s best.Omega offers global coverage with development, support, engineering, and manufacturing facilities in three continents. A network of dedicated Omega sales and business partners serves customers in more than 100 countries around the world.By increasing global safety and hygiene, Omega expects greater demand for laser-welded panels within India and surrounding countries. However, due to high transport costs and times, it is not possible for Omega to respond effectively to the market needs in India from the Netherlands. Their current production company in India, Omega Ice Hill, is also not capable of serving the Indian growth opportunities due to the organisation of the company, capacity shortage and quality requirements.Through the investment preparatory study Omega wants to analyse and study the feasibility to make innovative turn-around investments in the production facility for laser-welded panels in India.This study will demonstrate the technical and financial-economic feasibility of the investment.In 2016, a new managing director entered the company of Omega with the goal to create a group out of Omega rather than all individual production sites in order to realize their business strategy: to grow in terms of revenues, size and scope.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services - Dutch companies
